item.title: Yancy add a quote by Marquis de Sade
item.description: "Conversation, like certain portions of the anatomy, always runs more smoothly when lubricated." -- Marquis de Sade

item.title: Yancy add a quote by Erwin Schrödinger
item.description: "The task is...not so much to see what no one has yet seen; but to think what nobody has yet thought, about that which everybody sees." -- Erwin Schrödinger

item.title: Yancy add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I am burdened with what the Buddhists call the 'monkey mind' -- the thoughts that swing from limb to limb, stopping only to scratch themselves, spit and howl." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Yancy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Yancy add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "That's the problem with drinking, I thought, as I poured myself a drink. If something bad happens you drink in an attempt to forget; if something good happens you drink in order to celebrate; and if nothing happens you drink to make something happen." -- Charles Bukowski
